      ILogger deleteOlderThan​(int days)
      Deletes Log files older than the argument (in days).

      If days == 0, all log files will be deleted.

      • setLevel

        ILogger setLevel​(ILogger.Level l)

      • setLevel

        ILogger setLevel​(java.lang.String s)
        Assigns minimum logging level based on received level string.

        Normally this string is defined in Config.json.

        Can be built by passing fromJson CLI "-D=log_level=RULE" or setting it in the configuration file.

        Parameters:
        s - The string representing the minimum logging to be sat.
        Returns:
        Itself.

      • isLoggable

        boolean isLoggable​(ILogger.Level level)

      • deleteOlderThan

        ILogger deleteOlderThan​(int days)
        Deletes Log files older than the argument (in days).

        If days == 0, all log files will be deleted. If days lower than 0, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        days - Number of days to decide which files has to be deleted.
        Returns:
        Itself.

      • say

        boolean say​(java.lang.String msg)
        Unconditionally logs the message and shows it the console if ::isPrintable() returns true.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to log.
        Returns:
        Itself.
